page.title: 17HAULGH HALL-MANOR HOUSE
page.content: Haulgh Hall in Hilden Street was built about 1600 and was originally inhabited by the Haulgh family. IT is a small manor house which may have included a late Medieval building. It was sold in 1639 to Orlando Bridgeman, the son of the Bishop of Chester who had purchased the Great Lever estate. It was held by the Earls of Bradford until it was bought by Bolton Council, who rented it to tenants. Bolton Council have recently restored the property and in December 1984 it was bought by Mr. Eden. Part of the building is made from random stones which have a very rough surface and part of it is timber framed with cruck construction. It has a small square bay which sticks out like a porch which was traditionally known as the domestic chapel.
